revised_title: Formation of Alcohols in the Slow Combustion of Methane and Ethane
tldr: The authors conducted experiments on the slow combustion of methane and ethane at atmospheric pressure and found that alcohols, such as methyl and ethyl alcohol, are formed during the initial stages of combustion. They discovered that the ratio of alcohol to aldehyde decreases as the "induction period" approaches completion, proving that alcohol formation precedes that of the corresponding aldehyde.
